Detailed Description

Interface for subscription to event facility.

Definition in file sysEventsHandler.h.

Define Documentation

#define SYS_MAX_EVENTS   91U

The maximum number of events that can be defined in the System Environment. Any event ID must not be greater than this value.

Definition at line 29 of file sysEventsHandler.h.

Typedef Documentation

typedef uint8_t SYS_EventId_t

The type for event identifier.

Note that identifiers of events raised by the stack are defined in the BcEvents_t enumeration. The user can define its own set of event IDs in the application, subscribe to them and raise them, though the overall number of event IDs defined by both the stack and the application can not be greater than SYS_MAX_EVENTS, and an event ID value must not be greater than SYS_MAX_EVENTS.

Definition at line 45 of file sysEventsHandler.h.

typedef uintptr_t SYS_EventData_t

Data for event. Arbitrary unsigned integer, but large enough to hold pointer if required (such use is generally discouraged).

Definition at line 49 of file sysEventsHandler.h.
